pageContext.description: Butt broken off and flanges worn down.
pageContext.patina: Powdery patina light whitish green, except in places, especially on faces near edge, where olive green burnished patina still remains.
pageContext.associations: Part of a hoard of 14 palstaves of somewat similar type.
pageContext.collection: In the possession of Colonel Norton, 1917,Dolcorsllwyn Hall, Aberanyell, Montgomery
pageContext.site: wales,powys (montgomeryshire),nant saeson on mynydd tal-y-glanan,south of afon dugoed,about 1905
pageContext.remarks: 3 of the best are in possession of Colonel Norton (1917). 1 in Aberystwyth Museum, 1 in  Caersws Museum, 1 in Chester Museum, 1 given to a passing motorist, 7 distributed but destination unknown.
